data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_ClusterName_NotEmpty
data.value: Cluster name must be set.

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_MaxMemory_50Percent
data.value: We generally advise allocating 50% of the total available memory leaving the other half for the file system.

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_NegativeMinimumMasterNodes
data.value: min_master_nodes can not be less then 0

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_HttpPortMinimum
data.value: HTTP port must be empty or a value greater than {0}

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_TransportPortMinimum
data.value: Transport port must be empty or a value greater then {0}

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_PortMaximum
data.value: ports must be empty and may not exceed the port range with a maximum of {0}

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_EqualPorts
data.value: HTTP and transport cannot be bound to the same port: {0}

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_NodeName_NotEmpty
data.value: Node name must be set.

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_SelectedMemory_GreaterThanOrEqual250MB
data.value: The selected memory is less than 250mb. Elasticsearch generally works better the more memory you allocate to it.

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_SelectedMemory_LessThan32GB
data.value: Do not allocate more then 32GB for Elasticsearch. Java won't used compressed pointers.

data.name: LocationsModelValidator_Configuration
data.value: Configuration

data.name: LocationsModelValidator_Data
data.value: Data

data.name: LocationsModelValidator_DirectoryMustBeSpecified
data.value: {0} directory must be specified.

data.name: LocationsModelValidator_DirectoryMustBeChildOf
data.value: {0} directory must be a sub folder of {1} because the place in same folder flag was also set.

data.name: LocationsModelValidator_DirectoryMustNotBeRelative
data.value: {0} directory must not be relative.

data.name: LocationsModelValidator_DirectorySetToNonWritableLocation
data.value: {0} set to an unwritable program files location.

data.name: LocationsModelValidator_DirectoryUsesUnknownDrive
data.value: {0} directory uses unknown drive: {1}

data.name: LocationsModelValidator_Installation
data.value: Installation

data.name: LocationsModelValidator_Logs
data.value: Logs

data.name: PluginsModel_S3Repository
data.value: Allows Elasticsearch to use AWS S3 as a repository for snapshot/restore.

data.name: PluginsModel_AzureRepository
data.value: The Azure Repository plugin adds support for using Azure as a repository for Snapshot/Restore.

data.name: PluginsModel_ClojureLanguagePlugin
data.value: An elasticsearch plugin written in Clojure that provides clojure as a scripting language for elasticsearch queries.

data.name: PluginsModel_HdfsRepository
data.value: Allows Elasticsearch to use the Haddop file-system as a repository for snapshot/restore.

data.name: PluginsModel_ICUAnalysis
data.value: The ICU Analysis plugin integrates Lucene ICU module into elasticsearch, adding ICU relates analysis components.

data.name: PluginsModel_JapaneseAnalysis
data.value: The Japanese (kuromoji) Analysis plugin integrates Lucene kuromoji analysis module into elasticsearch.

data.name: PluginsModel_JavaScriptLanguagePlugin
data.value: The JavaScript language plugin allows to have javascript (or js) as the language of scripts to execute.

data.name: PluginsModel_MapperAttachments
data.value: The mapper attachments plugin adds the attachment type to Elasticsearch using Apache Tika. The attachment type allows to index different \"attachment\" type field (encoded as base64), for example, microsoft office formats, open document formats, ePub, HTML, and so on.

data.name: PluginsModel_PythonLanguagePlugin
data.value: The Python (jython) language plugin allows to have python as the language of scripts to execute.

data.name: PluginsModel_SmartChineseAnalysis
data.value: The Smart Chinese Analysis plugin integrates Lucene Smart Chinese analysis module into elasticsearch.

data.name: PluginsModel_StempelPolishAnalysis
data.value: The Stempel (Polish) Analysis plugin integrates Lucene stempel (Polish) analysis module into elasticsearch.

data.name: PluginType_Analysis
data.value: Analysis

data.name: PluginType_Discovery
data.value: Discovery

data.name: PluginType_Scripting
data.value: Scripting

data.name: PluginType_Snapshot
data.value: Snapshot

data.name: ServiceModelValidator_Password_NotEmpty_WhenUseExistingUser
data.value: Password must be specified when using an existing user.

data.name: ServiceModelValidator_CredentialsFailed
data.value: The provided windows account credentials are not valid.

data.name: ServiceModelValidator_MultipleRunAsTypes
data.value: Multiple run as flags have been specified causing an ambiguity which to use.

data.name: ServiceModelValidator_ServiceName_NotEmpty
data.value: Service name must be specified.

data.name: ServiceModelValidator_User_NotEmpty_WhenUseExistingUser
data.value: Username must be specified when using an existing user.

data.name: NoticeModelValidator_AlreadyInstalled
data.value: This version is already installed. Please uninstall first.

data.name: NoticeModelValidator_JavaInstalled
data.value: Could not find a valid Java installation.

data.name: NoticeModelValidator_BadElasticsearchYamlFile
data.value: The elasticsearch.yml file we found in ES_PATH_CONF appears to be invalid and prevented seeding current values.

data.name: NoticeModel_FromPrerelease_Header
data.value: Upgrading from a prerelease considerations

data.name: NoticeModel_ToPrerelease_Header
data.value: Running a prerelease considerations

data.name: NoticeModel_ExistingVersion
data.value: Previously installed version: {0}

data.name: NoticeModel_FromPrerelease
data.value: Data created in prerelease versions of elasticsearch might not be migratable to stable versions

data.name: NoticeModel_ToPrerelease
data.value: Please do not run elasticsearch prereleases in production

data.name: NoticeModel_MinorUp_Header
data.value: Minor Upgrade considerations

data.name: NoticeModel_MajorUp_Header
data.value: Major Upgrade considerations

data.name: NoticeModel_MajorDown_Header
data.value: Major Downgrade considerations

data.name: NoticeModel_MinorDown_Header
data.value: Minor Downgrade considerations

data.name: NoticeModel_PatchDown_Header
data.value: Patch Downgrade considerations

data.name: NoticeModel_MinorUp
data.value: You are running a minor upgrade please take this time to read more about the best practices

data.name: NoticeModel_MajorUp
data.value: You are running a major upgrade please take this time to read more about the best practices

data.name: NoticeModel_MajorDown
data.value: The chances are very high that the data will no longer be valid in this downgraded full major version. Please take this time to make sure you have offloaded any data to a different cluster through snapshot and restore and that the data folders in this cluster are empty. To migrate this data back into the downgraded cluster you need to perform a reindex.

data.name: NoticeModel_MinorDown
data.value: The chances are high that the data will no longer be valid in this downgraded minor version. Please take this time to make sure you have offloaded any data to a different cluster through snapshot and restore and that the data folders in this cluster are empty. To migrate this data back into the downgraded cluster you need to perform a reindex.

data.name: NoticeModel_PatchDown
data.value: The chances are high that the data will no longer be valid in this downgraded patch version. Please take this time to make sure you have offloaded any data to a different cluster through snapshot and restore and that the data folders in this cluster are empty. To migrate this data back into the downgraded cluster you need to perform a reindex.

data.name: InstallationModelValidator_NotAllModelsAreValid
data.value: One or more sub models are not valid

data.name: PluginsModel_AzureDiscovery
data.value: The Azure Discovery plugin uses the Azure API for unicast discovery.

data.name: PluginsModel_EC2Discovery
data.value: The EC2 discovery plugin uses the AWS API for unicast discovery.

data.name: PluginsModel_GCEDiscovery
data.value: The Google Compute Engine Discovery plugin uses the GCE API for unicast discovery.

data.name: PluginsModel_IngestAttachment
data.value: The ingest attachment plugin lets Elasticsearch extract file attachments in common formats (such as PPT, XLS, and PDF) by using the Apache text extraction library Tika. You can use the ingest attachment plugin as a replacement for the mapper attachment plugin.

data.name: PluginsModel_IngestGeoIP
data.value: The GeoIP processor adds information about the geographical location of IP addresses, based on data from the Maxmind databases. This processor adds this information by default under the geoip field.

data.name: PluginsModel_MapperMurmur3
data.value: The mapper-murmur3 plugin provides the ability to compute hash of field values at index-time and store them in the index. This can sometimes be helpful when running cardinality aggregations on high-cardinality and large string fields.

data.name: PluginsModel_MapperSize
data.value: The mapper-size plugin provides the _size meta field which, when enabled, indexes the size in bytes of the original _source field.

data.name: PluginsModel_Phonetic
data.value: The Phonetic Analysis plugin provides token filters which convert tokens to their phonetic representation using Soundex, Metaphone, and a variety of other algorithms.

data.name: PluginsModel_StoreSmb
data.value: The Store SMB plugin works around for a bug in Windows SMB and Java on Windows.

data.name: PluginsModel_XPack
data.value: X-Pack is an Elastic Stack extension that bundles security, alerting, monitoring, reporting, and graph capabilities into one easy-to-install package. While the X-Pack components are designed to work together seamlessly, you can easily enable or disable the features you want to use. X-Pack is a proprietary plugin that falls under the Elastic EULA. By selecting to install X-Pack, A 30 day fully featured trial license is applied upon installation.

data.name: PluginType_ApiExtensions
data.value: API Extensions

data.name: PluginType_Ingest
data.value: Ingest

data.name: PluginType_Mapper
data.value: Mapper

data.name: PluginType_Store
data.value: Store

data.name: PluginType_XPack
data.value: X-Pack

data.name: InstallOptions_ClusterName
data.value: The name of the cluster. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_ConfigDirectory
data.value: The config directory. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_DataDirectory
data.value: The data directory. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_DataNode
data.value: Whether this node is a Data node. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_HeapSize
data.value: The heap memory that will be allocated to the Elasticsearch Java Process. This should be more than 250mb and ideally less than 32GB (so that Java uses compressed pointers). Defaults to {0}mb for this installation

data.name: InstallOptions_IngestNode
data.value: Whether this node is an Ingest node. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_InstallDirectory
data.value: The installation directory. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_LockMemory
data.value: Whether to lock the process address space in RAM, preventing any Elasticsearch memory from being swapped out. This uses VirtualLock on Windows. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_LogsDirectory
data.value: The logs directory. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_MasterNode
data.value: Whether this node is a Master node. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_NodeName
data.value: The name of the node. Defaults to {0} for this installation

data.name: InstallOptions_Plugins
data.value: A comma-separated list of plugins to install as part of the Elasticsearch installation

data.name: InstallOptions_ServiceAutomatic
data.value: Whether to automatically start the service after Windows starts/restarts, if installing as a Windows Service. Defaults to {0}
data.comment: {0} = Default Start Service after Windows Starts/Restarts

data.name: InstallOptions_ServiceInstall
data.value: Whether to install Elasticsearch as a Windows service. Defaults to {0}
data.comment: {0} = Default Install as a Service value

data.name: InstallOptions_ServiceName
data.value: The name of the Windows service, if installing as a Windows Service. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_ServicePassword
data.value: Password for the specified Username, if installing as a Windows Service

data.name: InstallOptions_ServiceRunAsNetworkService
data.value: Whether to run the service using {0} if installing as a Windows Service. Defaults to {1}. If this value is false and {2} is not specified, the service will be run using {3}
data.comment: {0} = Network Service Account {1} = Default Network Service Account Name {2} = Service Username Install Option Name {3} = Local System Service Account

data.name: InstallOptions_ServiceStart
data.value: Whether to start the service after installation, if installing as a Windows Service. Defaults to {0}

data.name: InstallOptions_ServiceUsername
data.value: Whether to run the service using a specified Username, if installing as a Windows Service

data.name: InstallOptions_UnicastHosts
data.value: A comma-separated list of hosts to use for unicast discovery

data.name: SetupView_ExitText
data.value: Exit

data.name: SetupView_InstallText
data.value: Install

data.name: SetupView_NextText
data.value: Next

data.name: NoticeModelValidator_JavaMisconfigured
data.value: JAVA_HOME is set for both this user and the system. Please choose the desired Java installation by removing one of these environment variables.

data.name: NoticeModelValidator_Using32BitJava
data.value: Found a 32 bit java installation as the default in the registry, elasticsearch requires a 64bit JVM

data.name: ServiceModelValidator_User_Or_Password_Incorrect
data.value: User or Password is incorrect

data.name: NoticeModelValidator_HigherVersionInstalled
data.value: A higher version is already installed. In order to downgrade, you must uninstall this version first. PLEASE NOTE: an uninstall will always remove the data folder be sure you move it elsewhere if you need to keep it.

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_BasePath
data.value: Base Path

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_DefaultRoute
data.value: Default Route

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_HostNameMustNotBeEmpty
data.value: A host name must be specified.

data.name: ConfigurationModelValidator_RouteFormatMustBeValid
data.value: {0} is not a valid route format. Routes cannot start or end with '/`.

data.name: ConnectingModelValidator_ElasticsearchUrlMustBeSpecified
data.value: A URL to Elasticsearch must be specified.

data.name: ConnectingModelValidator_IndexMustBeSpecified
data.value: An index must be specified.

data.name: PluginsModelValidator_NoInternet
data.value: Plugin installation is online, meaning you need a connection to the internet to commence. Either deselect all plugins or connect to the internet and refresh the installer.
